content:
Diagnosis
	1. Chromophobe renal cell carcinoma, right kidney lower pole

	Date of diagnosis
	March 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Mar 2024 Right partial nephrectomy performed by Mr [redacted name]

	Radiotherapy
	Not indicated

	Chemotherapy
	Not indicated

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	No evidence of disease

	Current issues
	Post-operative recovery

	Summary of consultation
	This 58-year-old gentleman was referred following right partial nephrectomy for an incidentally detected renal mass. The surgery was uncomplicated with good preservation of renal function. Histology confirms a 4.2cm chromophobe renal cell carcinoma, completely excised with clear margins. Immunohistochemistry shows CD10 positivity. Staging CT chest/abdomen/pelvis shows no evidence of metastatic disease.

He has made an excellent post-operative recovery with good wound healing and stable renal function (creatinine 98). His main symptom is mild residual right-sided discomfort which is improving. He has returned to most normal activities and has resumed work as an accountant.

On examination today, his surgical wound is well-healed. His blood pressure is 138/82 and other observations are within normal range. Cardiorespiratory examination is unremarkable.

	Further investigations
	Routine surveillance imaging as per protocol

	Medication prescribed
	None required

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 3 months with repeat CT chest/abdomen/pelvis

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor blood pressure and renal function

	Summary of information given to the patient
	We have discussed the good prognosis associated with completely resected chromophobe renal cell carcinoma. [redacted name] understands the surveillance plan which involves regular imaging and monitoring of renal function.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: chromophobe renal cell carcinoma, 4.2cm, completely excised with clear margins

cancer_timeline.value: Right partial nephrectomy performed by Mr [redacted name]
Histology confirms 4.2cm chromophobe renal cell carcinoma, completely excised with clear margins, CD10 positive
Staging CT chest/abdomen/pelvis shows no evidence of metastatic disease

patient_facts.value: mild residual right-sided discomfort which is improving
surgical wound well-healed, blood pressure 138/82, cardiorespiratory examination unremarkable

status_updates.value: Stage II chromophobe renal cell carcinoma treated with partial nephrectomy. Excellent post-operative recovery with no evidence of residual disease.
Returned to most normal activities including work as an accountant
Oncology follow up in 3 months with imaging
